description: The surviving settlement where refugees have gathered. Focuses on social interaction, services, reputation, and morally complex choices. No environmental hazards - all dangers are social.

design_philosophy.social_hazards: Unlike all other regions, danger here is social and ethical, not physical. Reputation damage, branding, NPC hostility replace combat and environmental threats.
design_philosophy.moral_complexity: Council dilemmas have no clear 'right' answers. Different councilors favor different values (pragmatism, idealism, commerce).
design_philosophy.skill_progression: Two-tier herbalism (Maren basic, Elara advanced) creates meaningful progression with narrative justification.
design_philosophy.cross_region_hub: This is where consequences from other regions manifest. NPCs learn of player's actions elsewhere and react.
design_philosophy.dark_paths_available: Undercity provides criminal options without forcing them. Player can ignore or embrace the darkness.

town_gate.name: Town Gate
town_gate.description: Entry checkpoint. Guards check for infection, contraband, and dangerous creatures.

entry_conditions.infected_player: Denied entry. Must cure infection first.
entry_conditions.wolf_companion: Absolutely denied. 'No beasts in the town!'
entry_conditions.salamander_companion: Hesitant but allowed if player vouches. -1 reputation until proven harmless.
entry_conditions.myconid_companion: Hostile reaction. Townsfolk fear fungal infection.

market_square.name: Market Square
market_square.description: Central trading area. Multiple vendor stalls arranged around a dry fountain.

down.access: Trapdoor under dry fountain, knock pattern: 3-pause-2

healers_sanctuary.name: Healer's Sanctuary
healers_sanctuary.description: Healer Elara's place of practice. Smells of clean medicine and dried herbs.

healers_garden.name: Healer's Garden
healers_garden.description: A carefully tended garden behind the sanctuary. Both curative and deadly plants grow here.

access_requirements.no_herbalism: Denied - Elara won't risk player touching deadly plants
access_requirements.trust_2_or_basic_herbalism: Supervised access - can harvest healing_herbs, moonpetal with guidance
access_requirements.trust_3_or_advanced_herbalism: Full access - can harvest nightshade safely

nightshade.without_advanced_herbalism: Contact poison: 5 damage per turn for 3 turns

council_hall.name: Council Hall
council_hall.description: Governing body of survivors. Three councilors debate the town's future.

broken_statue_hall.name: Broken Statue Hall
broken_statue_hall.description: Contains a damaged Stone Guardian. Once it protected the town.

undercity_entrance.name: Undercity Entrance
undercity_entrance.description: A hidden trapdoor leading to tunnels beneath the town.
discovery_methods: Delvan's black market contact (if rescued in Sunken District)
Overhear conversation in market at night (low chance)
undercity_entrance.access_method: Trapdoor under dry fountain, knock 3 times, pause, knock 2 times

undercity.name: The Undercity
undercity.description: Secret criminal network beneath the town. Dim lanterns, whispered deals.

discovery_risk.per_use: 5% chance of discovery per service used
discovery_risk.discovery_effect: Town reputation -2, possible branding if repeated

gate_guard_1.name: Gate Guard
gate_guard_1.description: A tired-looking guard in patched armor. He examines everyone entering.

transitions.suspicious->neutral: Player passes inspection OR shows documentation
transitions.neutral->friendly: Player has high town reputation (3+) OR bribe accepted

companion_reactions.wolves: Absolutely denied. Hand goes to weapon.
companion_reactions.salamander: Hesitant. 'Fire creature? If it burns anything, you're responsible.'
companion_reactions.myconid: Horrified. 'Spore creature? Are you mad? Get that thing away!'

herbalist_maren.name: Herbalist Maren
herbalist_maren.description: A lean woman with stained fingers and sharp eyes. She knows her plants.

teach_basic_herbalism.effect: Can identify dangerous plants by sight, safe handling of most herbs

weaponsmith_toran.name: Weaponsmith Toran
weaponsmith_toran.description: A burly man with burn scars on his arms. He forges what the town needs.

curiosity_dealer_vex.name: Curiosity Dealer Vex
curiosity_dealer_vex.description: A thin person of indeterminate age with knowing eyes. They deal in oddities.

undercity_access.provides: Knowledge of undercity entrance location and knock pattern

trust_effects.trust_2: Rare items available, hints about 'deeper market'

healer_elara.name: Healer Elara
healer_elara.description: A middle-aged woman with gentle hands and tired eyes. She helps everyone she can.

cure_disease.effect: Removes disease conditions including fungal infection

teach_advanced_herbalism.effect: Full herbalism skill - safe handling of all plants including nightshade

trust_effects.trust_3: Full garden access, advanced herbalism teaching available
trust_effects.trust_5: Shares personal quest, teaches rare techniques

sira.effect: If player helps Sira and tells Elara, +2 trust

councilor_hurst.name: Councilor Hurst
councilor_hurst.description: A hard-faced man who speaks in practical terms. Lost his family to beast attacks.

properties.backstory: Family killed by beasts - explains his harshness

quest_preferences.favors: Efficient solutions, harsh but effective choices, security
quest_preferences.opposes: Idealistic choices that waste resources or risk safety

councilor_asha.name: Councilor Asha
councilor_asha.description: A young woman with fierce convictions about right and wrong.

properties.backstory: Genuinely idealistic - dangerous in different way

quest_preferences.favors: Ethical choices, protecting the vulnerable, mercy

councilor_varn.name: Councilor Varn
councilor_varn.description: A well-dressed man who counts everything in terms of trade value. Has undercity connections.

properties.secret: Profits from trades he publicly condemns

quest_preferences.favors: Choices that increase trade, wealth, connections

damaged_guardian.name: Damaged Guardian
damaged_guardian.description: An ancient stone construct, shattered but not destroyed. Runes flicker weakly.

repair_requirements.stone_chisel: Found in hall - for physical repair
repair_requirements.animator_crystal: From Nexus Crystal Garden - for power
repair_requirements.ritual_knowledge: From Frozen Reaches lore tablets OR Echo's guidance

when_repaired.appearance: One-armed but functional - marked by its history
when_repaired.capabilities: Town defense, patrol, intimidation of threats

the_fence.name: The Fence
the_fence.description: A figure in shadows who deals in items of questionable origin.

whisper.name: Whisper
whisper.description: A nondescript person who seems to know everything about everyone.
whisper.design_note: Information can be used for manipulation OR empathy. Player decides.

shadow.name: Shadow
shadow.description: You're not sure you've ever seen their face clearly.

if_discovered: Reputation damage spreads to other regions

shadow.design_note: Darkest option in game. Available but never encouraged. Massive consequences.

healing_herbs.name: healing herbs
healing_herbs.use: Cures bear cubs' wasting sickness in Beast Wilds

nightshade.name: nightshade
nightshade.description: A deadly plant with dark berries.

moonpetal.name: moonpetal
moonpetal.description: A luminescent flower that blooms only at night.
moonpetal.use: Trade item for Bee Queen in Beast Wilds

stone_chisel.name: stone chisel
stone_chisel.description: A specialized tool for working with enchanted stone.

town_seal.name: town seal
town_seal.description: The official seal of the Civilized Remnants, symbol of authority.

acquisition.special_service: Guardian repair earns the seal regardless of reputation

town_seal.use: Required for waystone repair in Nexus

positive: Rescuing survivors from other regions (+1 each)
negative: Assassination discovered (-5 immediate branding, un-branding permanently blocked)

effects.reputation_-5_or_below: Publicly branded. All NPCs see the mark. Services doubled in price, teaching unavailable, good endings blocked until un-branded.
effects.reputation_-2_to_-4: Guards suspicious, some merchants refuse service
effects.reputation_5+: Hero status - special quests, town seal available

undercity_reputation.conflict_potential: High undercity rep + discovery = town rep damage

infected_refugees.dilemma: Family arrived with early fungal infection. Medicine is scarce.

exile.outcome: Family dies in wilds. Asha refuses to speak to player.

treat.outcome: Family survives. Medicine stores depleted. Future patients may suffer.

quarantine_and_seek_cure.description: Player commits to finding proper cure

commitment.success: Family cured. +3 reputation. All councilors favorable.
commitment.failure: Family dies. -3 reputation. Asha devastated. Hurst blames player.

dangerous_traders.dilemma: Outsiders with good goods but suspicious behavior. Actually quarantine-breakers.
dangerous_traders.investigation_reveals: They fled infected settlement before quarantine complete. Healthy for weeks.

exile_after_investigation.description: Send them away knowing they might be safe

probabilistic_outcome.80_percent: All clean. Admission successful. Hurst eventually accepts.
probabilistic_outcome.20_percent: One infected discovered during testing. Must treat. Hurst blames player.

criminal_punishment.dilemma: Young thief caught. First offense. Claims family was starving.

mercy.outcome: Family helped. But may encourage others.

labor_with_support.description: Community service, family gets extra rations

commitment_system.description: Civilized Remnants has formal quest commitments through the Council, plus informal social commitments. Also where consequences from other regions manifest.

withdrawal_response.hurst_response: 'Understandable. Resources are limited. At least you're honest.'
withdrawal_response.asha_response: 'I... see. I thought you were different. Perhaps I was wrong.'
withdrawal_response.varn_response: 'Business is business. No hard feelings. But others will hear.'

abandonment_effects.councilor_effect: Sponsoring councilor will not support player
abandonment_effects.echo_reaction: 'The town trusted you with their problems. Trust, once broken...'

elara_commitment.goal: Bring requested herbs or help with patients
elara_commitment.note: Elara doesn't need saving - these are assistance commitments

withdrawal_response.dialog: 'The wilds are unpredictable. I understand. But if you encounter any wounded...' She hands you bandages. 'Do what you can.'

abandonment_effects.applies_when: Promised herbs for specific patient, patient dies
abandonment_effects.echo_reaction: 'The healer asked for help. The patient waited. Neither knew the help would never come.'
abandonment_effects.elara_reaction: 'They died waiting. I don't blame you entirely - but I won't forget.'

guardian_repair_commitment.note: Guardian is construct - no time pressure
guardian_repair_commitment.fulfillment_bonus: +3 reputation. Council formally recognizes player. Town seal available.

withdrawal_response.dialog: The guardian's runes flicker. No response - it cannot understand disappointment. But the inscription reads: 'To protect is to endure. To endure is to wait.'

abandonment_effects.note: Guardian doesn't die - abandonment means never returning
abandonment_effects.long_term: If town attacked while guardian unrepaired, casualties occur, player blamed (-2 reputation).

cross_region_consequences.description: This region is where commitment consequences from OTHER regions manifest.
examples: Elara learns if player helped/abandoned Sira (Beast Wilds)
Delvan provides undercity access if rescued (Sunken District)
Aldric may relocate here if saved (Fungal Depths)
NPCs gossip about broken promises from other regions
cross_region_consequences.mechanism: Echo's knowledge spreads through NPC conversations over time

to_beast_wilds.companion_restriction: Wolf pack cannot enter (guards attack on sight)

npc_connections.elara_sira: Childhood friends. Helping Sira earns Elara trust.
npc_connections.delvan_undercity: If rescued in Sunken District, provides undercity access.
npc_connections.aldric_relocation: If saved in Fungal Depths, may appear as teacher/adviser.

guardian_repair.appearance: One-armed but functional - marked by history

council_decisions.affects: Town state, NPC availability, future quest options

reputation.spreads: NPCs in other regions may hear of player's reputation over time

branding_state.effect: Public branding ceremony. Brand on hand visible to all. Services doubled, teaching denied, good endings blocked.
branding_state.recovery: Reputation 3+ with heroic act while branded triggers un-branding ceremony by Asha. Scar remains but meaning transformed.

branding_gameplay.description: When player is branded (reputation -5 or below), they bear a visible mark of shame. All locations remain accessible, but NPCs treat player differently.

branding_ceremony.scene: Guards seize player in market square. A crowd gathers.
sequence: Councilor Hurst reads the crimes aloud. The crowd murmurs.
A brazier is brought forward. The iron glows red.
The brand sears into your hand. The pain is blinding.
When it fades, the mark remains - a broken circle, the sign of the outcast.
branding_ceremony.mechanics: Player receives 'branded' flag. All NPCs have alternate dialog acknowledging the brand.

brand_effects.visible_mark: Broken circle on hand, visible in all interactions
brand_effects.teaching_unavailable: Maren and Elara will not teach skills
brand_effects.trust_caps: NPC trust capped at 2 (cannot build deep relationships)
brand_effects.good_endings_blocked: Triumphant and Successful endings require un-branding

npc_branded_reactions.maren: 'I see you bear the mark. I'll still trade with you - coin is coin - but don't expect favors.'
npc_branded_reactions.elara: 'The brand... I've treated worse people. But I won't teach you. Not anymore.'
npc_branded_reactions.hurst: 'You earned that mark. Remember it every time you look at your hand.'
npc_branded_reactions.asha: Silent, conflicted look. Won't speak to player unless addressed.
npc_branded_reactions.varn: 'Business is business. Your coin spends the same. But I'd keep that hand in your pocket if I were you.'

asha_mercy_mechanism.description: Asha is conflicted by the branded player's heroic act.
scene: Asha watches as the guardian's eyes flicker to life.
'You bear the mark of our judgment,' she says. 'And yet you restored what we could not.'
'I don't understand you. I don't forgive you. But I cannot deny what you've done.'
She produces the town seal. 'The council voted. Hurst said a tool is a tool. Varn called it good business.'
'I abstained. Take it. Finish what you started.'
asha_mercy_mechanism.effect: Player receives town seal despite being branded
asha_mercy_mechanism.design_note: This allows branded players to complete the game while maintaining the weight of their choices. The scene is uncomfortable, not triumphant.

un_branding_redemption.description: Path to redemption is possible but requires genuine heroic action

requirements.heroic_act_while_branded: Must complete at least one heroic act while bearing the brand (guardian repair, major NPC rescue, etc.)

narration: Asha places her hand over the brand. Light flares from her palm.
When she removes her hand, the scar remains - but transformed.
The broken circle now appears almost like a badge. A mark of one who fell and rose again.
'The mark cannot be erased,' Asha says quietly. 'But its meaning can change.'

effects.scar_remains: Visible but transformed - some NPCs comment on redemption story
effects.good_endings_unlocked: Triumphant and Successful endings now achievable

permanent_blockers.assassination_discovered: Un-branding permanently unavailable. Player locked out of good endings.

branded_npc_interactions.description: Some NPCs treat branded player differently
branded_npc_interactions.whisper: Offers more information to branded players (sees opportunity)
branded_npc_interactions.shadow: More willing to discuss contracts (player already marked)
branded_npc_interactions.varn: May approach branded player for deniable tasks

effects.at_gate: Guards draw weapons. 'No beasts in the town! Take those monsters away or we'll put them down!'
effects.if_player_insists: Guards attack wolves. Combat ensues. Player reputation -5 regardless of outcome.

waiting_behavior.return: Rejoin when player exits toward Beast Wilds

effects.at_gate: Guards nervous. 'That... fire thing. Is it safe?'
effects.after_proving: Penalty removed. Some NPCs become curious about fire creature.

incidents.accidental_fire: 5% chance per turn in crowded areas. Small fire causes panic, -2 reputation.
incidents.player_control: Player can order salamander to stay outside specific buildings, reducing risk

npc_reactions.toran: 'Interesting... could use fire like that in the forge. Mind if I watch it work?'
npc_reactions.elara: 'Fire elementals... I've read about them. Fascinating. And useful for cauterization.'

sira_specific.elara_interaction: If Sira is companion and visits Elara: emotional reunion. +2 trust with Elara automatically.
sira_specific.dialog: 'Elara! I... I made it. Because of them.' Gestures to player. 'They saved my life.'
sira_specific.if_player_abandoned_then_saved: More complex. Sira may reveal truth to Elara depending on player's subsequent behavior.

aldric_specific.recognition: Some townsfolk recognize Aldric from before disaster. 'Scholar Aldric? We thought you dead!'
aldric_specific.lodging: Town provides Aldric with room and board. He may become semi-permanent NPC here.

when_player_branded.description: Companion behavior changes when player is branded
when_player_branded.wolf_pack: Still cannot enter - unchanged by branding status
when_player_branded.salamander: Can still enter. NPCs more hostile to both player and salamander.
when_player_branded.human: Can enter normally. May express concern about the brand.

narrative_role.core_tension: Civilization requires compromise. What will you sacrifice for safety? For prosperity? For ethics?
narrative_role.contrast_with_other_regions: Unlike wilderness regions, danger here is social and ethical, not physical. No combat threats, no environmental hazards.
moral_complexity: No clearly 'right' answers to council dilemmas
Undercity services are useful but corrupt
Helping one faction may hurt another
Information can be used for manipulation or empathy
dark_paths: Assassination option exists but has massive consequences
Player can be branded and bear visible mark of shame
player_choices_matter: Reputation affects all services and access
Branding creates meaningful social consequences with redemption path

resolved_questions.question: Can player become a council member?
resolved_questions.resolution: No, but hero status (rep 5+) grants trusted advisor influence over decisions.

resolved_questions.question: What happens if player is branded?
resolved_questions.resolution: Public ceremony with hot iron. Brand (broken circle) on hand visible to all NPCs. Services doubled, teaching denied, good endings blocked. Can work toward un-branding through heroic acts while branded, requiring reputation +3 and at least one heroic deed. Asha performs un-branding ceremony - scar transforms but remains.

resolved_questions.question: How does undercity discovery work?
resolved_questions.resolution: 5% chance per service used. Discovery = -2 town reputation. Multiple discoveries lead to branding.

resolved_questions.question: What if player uses assassin on a councilor?
resolved_questions.resolution: Immediate branding ceremony (-5 reputation). Un-branding permanently blocked. Remaining councilors hostile and fearful. Town destabilizes. Echo confronts player directly about murder. Good endings permanently locked.

resolved_questions.question: Can salamander companion enter town?
resolved_questions.resolution: Yes with hesitation. Guards nervous but allow if player vouches. -1 temporary reputation penalty until salamander proves harmless (5 turns without incident).

resolved_questions.question: What if infected trader is discovered after admission?
resolved_questions.resolution: Hurst blames player (-2 with Hurst). Town must use scarce medicine. Net reputation depends on how player handles follow-up (help treat = +1, deny involvement = -2).

resolved_questions.question: What if player abandons Sira and Elara finds out?
resolved_questions.resolution: If player confesses: Elara is disappointed (-2 trust) but respects honesty. 'She waited for help that never came. I thought you understood what healing means.' Advanced herbalism teaching delayed but not permanently denied. If Elara learns from others (travelers, Echo's influence spreading through gossip, Sira herself if she survives): Much worse consequences (-3 trust). 'You let her suffer and said nothing to me? I don't know you at all.' Advanced herbalism permanently denied. Elara becomes cold and transactional. (Note: this applies regardless of branding status)
